questions.question_text: A project team on a four-year project has a shortage of workspace within an office. Which of the following is the MOST viable solution for the project team while ensuring work hours are not wasted?

choices.A: Secure a new facility, permit remote work, and reduce staff.
choices.C: Implement BYOD, secure a new facility, and utilize shared workspaces.
choices.B: Reduce staff, implement BYOD, and permit remote work.
choices.D: Permit remote work, utilize shared workspaces, and implement BYOD.

discussion.content: How does implementing BYOD help with limited workspace? Answer A seems more applicable here. Get more space, work from home, have fewer people? BYOD won't help anything.

questions.answer_description: Reference: Kim Heldman, CompTIA Project+ Study Guide, 2nd Edition, Sybex, Indianapolis, 2017, p. 294

discussion.content:
The NEXT step after justifying a required change with the associated impact on the project is B. Approval.

After the project manager has identified and evaluated the impact of the required change, the next step is to seek approval from the relevant stakeholders. This may include obtaining formal approval from a change control board, project sponsor, or other decision-making body before proceeding with implementation.

Once the change is approved, the project manager can move forward with implementation and validation to ensure that the change has been successfully incorporated into the project. Auditing may be conducted later in the project to assess the effectiveness of the change and identify areas for improvement.

questions.question_text:
A project manager is justifying a required change with the associated impact on the project.
Which of the following is the NEXT step?
A project is in the initiation phase. Which of the following tasks will take place during this phase?

discussion.content:
C. Create a project charter.

The initiation phase is the first phase of the project management process, where the project's scope, objectives, and stakeholders are identified, and a project charter is created. The project charter defines the project's vision, objectives, scope, and high-level requirements and is approved by the project sponsor and stakeholders. The other tasks mentioned, such as developing a WBS, defining project requirements, and acquiring project resources, typically take place in the planning phase.
